text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Hasegawa was born in Uji on February 11, 1969. After graduating from Osaka University of Economics, he joined Japan Soccer League club Honda in 1991. In 1992, he moved to J1 League club Kashima Antlers. He mainly played as regular player in 1990s. In 2000, the club won all three major titles in Japan; the J1 League, J.League Cup and Emperor's Cup, for the first time in J1 League history. The club were the champions J1 League four times, J.League Cup three times and Emperor's Cup twice. He retired in July 2003. On 15 February 1995, Hasegawa debuted for the Japan national team against Australia. He was also selected for Japan in 1996.
